lines.text: Enter the ARCHBISHOP OF YORK and SIR MICHAEL

lines.speaker: archbishop of york
lines.text: Hie, good Sir Michael bear this sealed brief With winged haste to the lord marshal This to my cousin Scroop, and all the rest To whom they are directed. If you knew How much they do to import, you would make haste.

lines.speaker: sir michael
lines.text: My good lord, I guess their tenor.

lines.speaker: archbishop of york
lines.text: Like enough you do. Tomorrow, good Sir Michael, is a day Wherein the fortune of ten thousand men Must bide the touch for, sir, at Shrewsbury, As I am truly given to understand, The king with mighty and quickraised power Meets with Lord Harry: and, I fear, Sir Michael, What with the sickness of Northumberland, Whose power was in the first proportion, And what with Owen Glendowers absence thence, Who with them was a rated sinew too And comes not in, oerruled by prophecies, I fear the power of Percy is too weak To wage an instant trial with the king.

lines.speaker: sir michael
lines.text: Why, my good lord, you need not fear There is Douglas and Lord Mortimer.

lines.speaker: sir michael
lines.text: But there is Mordake, Vernon, Lord Harry Percy, And there is my Lord of Worcester and a head Of gallant warriors, noble gentlemen.

lines.speaker: archbishop of york
lines.text: And so there is: but yet the king hath drawn The special head of all the land together: The Prince of Wales, Lord John of Lancaster, The noble Westmoreland and warlike Blunt And moe corrivals and dear men Of estimation and command in arms.

lines.speaker: sir michael
lines.text: Doubt not, my lord, they shall be well opposed.

lines.speaker: archbishop of york
lines.text: I hope no less, yet needful tis to fear And, to prevent the worst, Sir Michael, speed: For if Lord Percy thrive not, ere the king Dismiss his power, he means to visit us, For he hath heard of our confederacy, And tis but wisdom to make strong against him: Therefore make haste. I must go write again To other friends and so farewell, Sir Michael.
